intro: Epilobium cockayneanum, commonly known as the purple willow herb, is a herbaceous plant native to the British Isles. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and its clusters of pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils along stream banks and woodland edges. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. Epilobium cockayneanum is also valued for its ecological role, providing nectar for pollinators.
